location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: File 4537/1927 Pt 1 'Iraq: Question of exemption from taxation of Shaikhs of Kuwait & Mohammerah'

mods.abstract: Correspondence, minutes, memoranda, and other papers concerning the question of a tax exemption on date gardens in Iraq belonging to the Shaikh of Kuwait and the Shaikh of Mohammerah. The papers cover: a review of Britain's historic commitments in the region; increasing opposition to the exemption from the Iraqi Government and press; discussion of the legal aspect of the question; the question in relation to the drafting of a new treaty with Iraq; records of interdepartmental meetings held, usually at the Colonial Office, to discuss the matter.Principal correspondents include: the Foreign Office; the High Commissioner in Iraq; the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf; the Colonial Office; the Treasury; Shaikh Ahmed al-Jabir as-Subah [Aḥmad al-Jābir Āl Ṣabāḥ], Ruler of Kuwait; the British Legation, Tehran; the Political Agent, Kuwait; and officials of the Government of Iraq.
